newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.AFRICA'S DURBAN PORT HANDLES RECORD 2,014 SHIPS.
newsitem.headline: S.AFRICA'S DURBAN PORT HANDLES RECORD 2,014 SHIPS.

text.p: South Africa's Durban harbour, the busiest port in Africa, handled a record number of 2,014 cargo ships over July and August, Portnet said on Wednesday.

"The port of Durban has experienced one of the busiest periods during the months of July and August this year when the port handled the highest number of ship movements since the Suez Canal crisis during 1971," Portnet said in a statement.
"A record number of vessel movements, 2,014, were recorded," the parastatal said.
A total of 3,668 ships were handled in all South African ports, with Cape Town recording 1,043 and Richards Bay 304 ships over the same period.
